edu.stanford.math.plex4.io
Class FileIOUtility

java.lang.Object
  edu.stanford.math.plex4.io.FileIOUtility

public class FileIOUtility
extends java.lang.Object

This class contains various static functions for reading and writing files of different types.

Author:
Tim Harrington, Andrew Tausz

                                 boolean append)
                          throws java.io.IOException
This function saves a string to a text file.

Parameters:
filePath - the path of the file to write to
contents - a string holding the contents to write
append - if true, then the file will be appended to
Throws:

readCSVFile

public static Table readCSVFile(java.lang.String filename,
                                java.lang.String separator,
                                boolean readTitle,
                                boolean readHeadings)
                         throws java.io.IOException
This function reads a CSV file and outputs the values into a Table object. The format of the file is as follows: [] [<Heading1, ..., HeadingN>] <Entry11, ..., Entry1N> <EntryM1, ..., EntryMN> The input argument readTitle should be true if and only if the file contains a title on its first line. The input argument readHeadings should be true if and only if the file contains the column headings on the file just before the first data row. Columns are assumed to be separated by the specified separator, and rows are assumed to be separated by a newline. <P> <DD><DL> <DT><B>Parameters:</B><DD><CODE>filename</CODE> - the filename of the file to read from<DD><CODE>separator</CODE> - the separator between columns<DD><CODE>readTitle</CODE> - should be true iff the file contains a title<DD><CODE>readHeadings</CODE> - should be true iff the file contains the column headings <DT><B>Returns:</B><DD>a Table object containing the contents of the file <DT><B>Throws:</B> <DD><CODE>java.io.IOException</CODE></DL> </DD> </DL> <HR> <A java.lang.String separator) throws java.io.IOException</PRE> <DL> <DD><DL> <DT><B>Throws:</B> <DD><CODE>java.io.IOException</CODE></DL> </DD> </DL> <HR> <A NAME="serializeObject(java.lang.Object,
